Job Title: Marketing Media Assistant - REMOTE

Location: Birmingham, AL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Public Relations, Writing/Editing

Description:
Salary Range : $52,200 - $78,200 Annual

Job Details

The stated pay range is based on a national average location. Actual salary is determined by factors including relevant work experience, skills, and location. This position is bonus-eligible.

CNO Financial Group’s Marketing Team is hiring a Media Marketing Assistant to contribute to the media team with a focus on ensuring the media runs as ordered. This role will monitor paid media and will use judgment to find resolutions and work with vendors when media is not run correctly. The Marketing Media Assistant will work closely with the Media Buyer(s) and work with pre/post logs, station set-up, and trafficking. This position may also provide coverage to other Marketing roles as needed.

As a Media Marketing Assistant , your responsibilities will include:

Working with Media Buyer(s) on daily buying processes: data entry, station set-ups, payment set-ups, etc.Participating in internal and external weekly conference calls regarding media and/or production resultsVerifying media runs as ordered and negotiating station credit when neededOrdering customized dubs from vendors.Overseeing creative approvals.Traffic instructions to stations and gather confirmations.Reconciling invoices within CoreDirect media systemObtain station avails.Request and distribute daily pre-logs and weekly post-logs.Review marketing/finance reports and test plans as needed.Support telemarketing management as needed - allocating 800#s and sharing with vendors.


The Media Marketing Assistant position is well-suited for you if you:

Possess a solid understanding of TV/OTT/Audio/OOHHave familiarity with CoreDirect Media Management systemDemonstrate proficiency in media metrics and working knowledge of media research toolsCan collaborate and interact with outside vendors and partners


What you’ll need:

Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Media, or a related field1-2 years of prior work experience in Media or MarketingWillingness to work Central or Eastern time zone business hours


What will set you apart:

The ability to problem solve and work independentlyThe ability to build stable and collaborative working relationships, both internally and externallyStrong verbal and written communication skillsA passion for staying current on the ever-changing market landscape.


The Company offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements:

Medical insuranceDental insuranceVision insurance401(k) retirement plan with company matchShort-term & long-term disability insurancePaid time off and corporate holidays,Paid parental leaveCompany-paid life insurance


Click on this link for additional information.

CNO embraces flexibility and encourages you to work where you’re most productive. Associates who live within a 60-mile radius of a corporate office (Birmingham, Carmel, Chicago, Orlando, and Milwaukee) have access to come into that office.

Associates who live outside of a 60-mile radius of a corporate office (Birmingham, Carmel, Chicago, Orlando, and Milwaukee) may perform this role full-time work from home (WFH) from any US-based location, as long as you are willing to work central or eastern time zone hours.

All associates may be asked to travel to varying corporate offices periodically. Work cannot be performed from outside of the United States.

CNO provides life and health insurance, annuities, financial services, and workforce benefits solutions through our family of brands and supported by our associates and agents. Our customers work hard to save for the future, and we help protect their health, income and retirement needs with 3.2 million policies and more than $35 billion in total assets. Our 3,400 associates, 8,600 exclusive agents, and independent partner agents guide individuals, families, and businesses through a lifetime of financial decisions.

We are financially strong and well-positioned for continued growth, and we are grounded in our core values of Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DE&I); Integrity, Customer Focus, Excellence, and Teamwork. We have offices in more than 260 communities in the U.S., including our headquarters in Carmel, Indiana, and corporate offices in Birmingham, Chicago, Orlando, and Milwaukee.

At CNO Financial Group, we’re always looking forward—to the security and stability we help create for our insurance brands’ customers, and the growth we create within our own company. We're looking for ambitious people who want to do more. We'll provide you with opportunities to grow your skills through challenging professional experiences.

If you're looking for a culture that encourages development, helps you reach your potential, and rewards you for your contribution, then CNO Financial Group is right for you. For more information, visit CNOinc.com.
